research_thread.statement: Does RRP depletion follow exponential decay?
research_thread.context: Testing mixed citation types for evidence pack support.
research_thread.why_it_matters: Validates linter accepts evidence pack citations.

hypothesis_slate.name: Exponential decay model
hypothesis_slate.claim: RRP follows exponential decay with τ ≈ 500ms.

hypothesis_slate.name: Activity-dependent recovery
hypothesis_slate.claim: Recovery rate varies with prior activation.

hypothesis_slate.name: Third Alternative
hypothesis_slate.claim: Both models are incomplete; hybrid mechanism exists.
hypothesis_slate.mechanism: Could involve state-dependent switching between modes.

discriminative_tests.name: Depletion time course
discriminative_tests.procedure: Measure RRP at multiple timepoints during sustained stimulation.
discriminative_tests.potency_check: Include positive control with known exponential decay.

discriminative_tests.name: Recovery rate measurement
discriminative_tests.procedure: Apply paired pulses at varying intervals post-depletion per EV-002.

assumption_ledger.name: RRP is measurable
assumption_ledger.statement: Readily releasable pool can be quantified via evoked release.
assumption_ledger.load: If wrong, all measurements are invalid.

assumption_ledger.name: Scale check: τ vs observation window
assumption_ledger.statement: Observation window must exceed τ by 3x for reliable fitting.
assumption_ledger.load: If wrong, τ estimates are unreliable.

assumption_ledger.name: Vesicle independence
assumption_ledger.statement: Individual vesicle release events are independent (EV-001#E3).

adversarial_critique.name: Prior session killed H2-like hypothesis
adversarial_critique.attack: EV-003 shows a similar fixed-rate hypothesis was killed previously.
adversarial_critique.evidence: EV-003#E1 documents T3 results contradicting fixed-rate recovery.

adversarial_critique.name: Temperature sensitivity
adversarial_critique.attack: EV-004 shows τ varies strongly with temperature (§42-45).
adversarial_critique.evidence: Both H1 and H2 may oversimplify temperature effects.
adversarial_critique.current_status: Consider temperature control in T1 and T2.
